title: Visiting Academic visa (subclass 419)
summary: This page provides information about the Visiting Academic visa (subclass 419), which closed to new applications in 2012. It outlines the rights and obligations of current visa holders and explains obligations for organisations approved as sponsors. It also includes details on family applications, reporting changes, and sponsor responsibilities under Australian migration law.

what_you_can_do: Enter Australia at any time after visa grant
Conduct research or the activity specified in the visa application

general_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia
work_restrictions: Work only in the position for which the visa was granted
Engage only in activities consistent with the visa application
Work only for the sponsoring employer
Not work for a different employer or take a second job
Not receive a salary without Secretary approval
if_employment_ceases: Find another training and research sponsor or visiting academic sponsor
Find an employer willing to sponsor you

family_members.family_application_process: Family can apply to join the visa holder by lodging an application for a Training and Research visa (subclass 402)
family_members.required_document: Letter from the visa holder's sponsor agreeing to sponsor the family

changes_to_report: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
notify_changes.instructions_reference: See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation

sponsors.eligible_sponsors: Organisations already approved as visiting academic sponsors under subclass 419 before 24 November 2012
sponsors.use_of_existing_approval: May be used to sponsor Training and Research visa (subclass 402) applicants until approval expires
sponsors.post_expiry_requirement: Must apply as a Training and Research sponsor or Professional Development sponsor under subclass 402
sponsors.recommended_application_timeframe: At least 2 to 3 months before existing sponsorship approval ends
sponsors.sponsorship_duration: Valid for up to 3 years from approval date
sponsor_obligations: Notify the department when certain events occur
Provide records and information to the Minister when requested
Not recover, transfer, or charge certain costs to another person
Ensure visa holder works in the nominated occupation, program, or activity
Pay travel costs for sponsored people to leave Australia
Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
Secure reasonable accommodation for sponsored individuals

cooperate_with_inspectors.obligation_start: Day sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
cooperate_with_inspectors.obligation_end: Five years after sponsorship ends or work agreement ceases
forms_of_cooperation: Not preventing access to persons with custody of records
Providing access for interviews with persons on the premises

required_records: Any required notifications made to the department
Date of notification and method/location of submission
record_keeping.record_requirements: Records must be in reproducible format and some must be independently verifiable
record_keeping.obligation_end: Two years after the sponsor is no longer approved AND no longer sponsoring anyone
record_keeping.maximum_duration: No records required to be kept longer than five years

when_required: To determine if obligations are being or have been met
To assess circumstances in which administrative action may be taken
record_types: Records required under Commonwealth, state, or territory law
provide_records_to_minister.obligation_start: Day sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
provide_records_to_minister.obligation_end: Two years after sponsorship or work agreement ceases AND no sponsored visa holder remains

events_to_notify: Primary sponsored person fails to participate in the nominated activity
Changes to sponsorâ€™s address or contact details
mandatory_notifications.obligation_start: Day sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
mandatory_notifications.obligation_end: Two years after sponsorship or work agreement ends AND no sponsored persons remain
